<div class=WordSection1>

<h2><span class=SpellE><span style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>CompSci</span></span><span
style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'> (CS) 271 — Introduction to Artificial
Intelligence — <span class=GramE>Fall</span> 2011</span><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>Current Announcements: <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;color:#0033BB'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Mid-term Exam key is posted below in the syllabus (</span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Week 6: <span class=GramE>Thu.,</span>
27 Oct.), also below in <a href="#_Study_Guides_---">Study Guides</a>,<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> </b></span><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>and
also available <a
href="../cs271-old-tests/2011-fq-cs271-old-tests/midterm-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.</span><span
style='color:#0033BB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>IMPORTANT:</span></b><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>You
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>must</span></b>
notify me <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>immediately</span></b>
if you intend to use this course to satisfy the CS M.S. Comprehensive Exam
requirement. Please see additional info below in the section on </span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'><a
href="#_The_Computer_Science">The Computer Science MS Comprehensive Exam.</a> </span><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>You are NOT registered for
the CS MS Exam UNLESS you have received an email message from me that states
explicitly, “I hereby confirm you for the CS-271 CS MS Exam.”</span><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>At
the request of several students, links to the optional project shells have been
posted (<a href="#_Optional_Projects:">here</a>).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please let me know if you encounter any
difficulties.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>At
the suggestion of a student, previous CS-271 quizzes and exams are available as
study guides (<a href="#_Study_Guides_---">here</a>).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>As an incentive to study this material,
at least one question from a previous quiz or Exam will appear on every new
quiz or Exam.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Please
note that I have updated the background reading for week 2 to the more recent
DARPA Urban Challenge, which is now posted on the class website and is available
here:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:.5in'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><a
href="http://www.ri.cmu.edu/pub_files/2009/6/aimag2009_urmson.pdf">http://www.ri.cmu.edu/pub_files/2009/6/aimag2009_urmson.pdf</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Also
on the class website for week 2, under "Cultural Interest," I have
posted links to some videos you may find interesting and amusing.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Perhaps some of the videos might spark
ideas for discussion?<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>At
the request of several students, I will offer three optional projects.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The first is a <a
href="../projects/sudoku-solver/aiproject2011.pdf">Sudoku Solver</a>. <span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>A Maze Solver and a Connect-K game will
follow shortly.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Assigned
but ungraded homework has been posted on the week-by-week schedule below.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Later I may add some more assignments,
and/or rearrange the timing of some assignments.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Current
announcements will appear here, at top-level, for quick and easy inspection.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Email: <a

mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(If you send email, please put

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic principles
of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some </span>basic
AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and their
limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Please Note:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>(1)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>This class is intended as a </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>broad
introduction to AI</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'> for graduate students who have had </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>minimal
or no exposure to AI previously.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'> Students who have taken
strong AI courses at the undergraduate level may wish to skip or waive this
course, and instead take a more specialized course in AI or machine learning
immediately.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;color:black;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>In particular, if you previously have had a
strong introductory course in AI from the <span class=SpellE>Russell&Norvig</span>
textbook, then most of the material covered here will seem familiar and
redundant to you.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You strongly
should consider proceeding directly to a more specialized course in AI or
machine learning.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='text-indent:.25in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>(2) Class enrollment is currently 72, with 115
requests.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Due to the bad economy
and system-wide UC budget cuts, I have no TA and only a single reader for the
entire class. Please realize that we will have to make some adjustments to
accommodate the high student load.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please “learn friendly.”</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>On every second Tuesday, the first 20 minutes will be an in-class pop
quiz, followed by lecture.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The
frequent quizzes are intended to encourage you to stay current with the course
material.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On every Thursday,
roughly the first hour will be lecture, and the final 15-20 minutes will be
open discussion of the weekly background reading. Your active participation in
the discussion is a required part of the course, and you are not allowed to
leave class when the reading discussion begins. I believe it is important at
the graduate level for students to grapple with and engage in the intellectual
content of the course material.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers; it shocked me to encounter this level of personal
degradation at the graduate level, but I cannot control it and I remain
determined to create a fair and honest educational experience for all students
as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>Required:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Russell
& <span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span
class=GramE> :</span> Artificial Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You place yourself at a distinct
disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>R&N
estimates that about 20% of the material in the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition is new
from the 2<sup>nd</sup> edition.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Several of the chapters and exercises have been rearranged.</span><strong>
</strong><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(</b>A kind and helpful student
has elucidated some of the differences between the 2<sup>nd</sup> & 3<sup>rd</sup>
editions; <a href="../differencesEd3vsEd2.pdf">click here</a>.)<span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do
deplore the high cost of textbooks.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>You are likely to find the book cheaper if you search online at
EBay.com, Amazon.com, and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A student
kindly contributed the following suggestion, for which I cannot vouch, and
which I provide for your use if it is useful to you:<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Hello, <br>
<br>
I just wanted to point out that there does <span class=GramE>exist</span> an
international edition of the book which can be bought for around $40-50. I
cannot comment on what specific differences there are for this particular book,
though they are usually very small (exercises moved around, <span class=SpellE>etc</span>).
Obviously, it is in paperback. <br>
<br>
<a href="http://www.valorebooks.com/affiliate/buy/siteID=e79mzf/ISBN=0136042597">http://www.valorebooks.com/affiliate/buy/siteID=e79mzf/ISBN=0136042597</a>
<br>
<br>
<a
href="http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=4161131466&cm_ven=sws&cm_cat=sws&cm_pla=sws&cm_ite=4161131466&afn_sr=para&para_l=1">http://www.abebooks.com/servlet/BookDetailsPL?bi=4161131466&cm_ven=sws&cm_cat=sws&cm_pla=sws&cm_ite=4161131466&afn_sr=para&para_l=1</a>
<br>
<br>
<a href="http://www.biblio.com/books/360025589.html">http://www.biblio.com/books/360025589.html</a>
<br>
<br>
Personally I plan on using this book for a while so I bought the hardcover
version, but I just wanted to point out that this is an option for those
looking for a more 'economical' route. <br>
<br>
~ XXXXXX [name <span class=SpellE>anonymized</span> to protect student privacy]</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h2><a name="_Grading:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Grading:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
grade will be based on the bi-weekly </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>quizzes
(20%), a mid-term exam (40%), and a final exam (40%).</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your participation in the open
discussion on Thursdays is required but ungraded, though you will be penalized
if you do not participate actively.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Quizzes will be given the first 20 minutes of class every
second Tuesday (starting the third Tuesday, and adjusted for the mid-term
exam).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your lowest quiz score will be
discarded in computing your grade.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>It is not possible to make-up missed quizzes, but one missed quiz may be
discarded as your lowest quiz score.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The mid-term exam will be given in class on Thursday,
October 27, and is closed-book, closed-notes.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The final exam will be given on Friday, December 9, 10:30 -
12:30 p.m., and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The final exam will cover all course
material from the entire quarter, but mostly the second half.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Dates
and times for all final exams are set by the UCI Registrar (<a
href="http://www.reg.uci.edu/calendars/finals/schedule-201112.html">Final Exam
Schedule 2011-12</a>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Everyone is expected to read the background reading, and to
come to class prepared to engage in graduate-level intellectual discussion of the
subject matter. Arrive in class with: (1) a general understanding of the
reading; (2) one interesting point about the reading; and (3) one interesting
question about the reading.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>[Note:
Due to the large class size, not everyone may get to talk each session, but you
are required to participate actively at least once as the term goes along.] <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo9'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Every student who fills out a course evaluation
for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade, free and
clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>EEE will
return to me the names of students who fill out evaluations (but not the
content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final
grade of each such named student.</span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Student
course evaluations are very important to me for monitoring and improving the
course content, and very important to UCI for evaluating our success at our
educational mission.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>*Please* fill
out your student course evaluations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>“Bonus Points” will be awarded, at my sole
discretion, (1) to the first student who spots a genuine technical error (typos
don’t count) in any of the course materials before I spot it too, and (2)
for helpful contributions to the class as we go along.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>A bonus point is equivalent to a quiz
point.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

you intend </b><b><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>to use this course to satisfy the CS M.S.
Comprehensive Exam requirement (info from the ICS SAO appears <a
href="../Student_MSCompExam2011.docx">here</a>)</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span class=GramE><span
style='color:red'>If you so intend, please email me IMMEDIATELY stating your
intention.</span></span> <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p> </o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Please include your
full name and your UCI Student ID#.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Send the message from your UCI email account (to ensure integrity and
prevent identity theft).<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p> </o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>The UCI Registrar
will not allow me to post a list of students who have so notified me (because
of student privacy regulations). <span style='color:red'>You are NOT registered
for the CS MS Exam UNLESS you have received an email message from me that
states explicitly, “</span></b><span style='color:red'>I hereby confirm
you for the CS-271 CS MS Exam<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>.”</b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></p>

score for the CS MS Exam will be based only on your mid-term exam (50%) and
final exam (50%).</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You will pass
the CS MS Exam if, and only if, your MS Exam score would result in a passing
grade (i.e., a grade of “B” or better) in CS-271 for Fall Quarter
2011. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Optional_Projects:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Optional Projects:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;color:red'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>For interested
students, I will offer three optional projects that I have used in earlier
classes. Due to limited resources these projects are ungraded. I suggest that
you form teams of two people each; one person types the code while the other
looks over their shoulder, and they switch roles frequently.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.25in'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>(1<span
class=GramE>)</span><a href="../projects/maze-solver/game.exe">Maze Solver</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This project corresponds to Informed
Search Problems (Chapter 3 in your book). Your job is to write an AI agent that
can find paths through a maze better than you can.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.25in'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>You are employed by a company
that makes interactive video games. The game's 2D world has a large number of
fixed polygonal obstacles of various shapes and sizes on the screen. You are
assigned to write the controller for one of the moving figures on the screen.
Whenever a gold coin appears on the screen, your figure is to walk to the coin
as rapidly as possible, avoiding all obstacles. Input is the screen locations
of your figure, the gold coin, and the locations and shapes of all obstacles.
Output is to be the path your figure will follow to the coin. [<a
href="../projects/maze-solver/maze-experts-on-hardest-mazes.pdf">Click here for
solved examples</a>.]</span><o:p></o:p></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><u1:p> </u1:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Interestingly, this is also the
same basic problem as robot arm navigation through a crowded workspace. In the
robot arm navigation problem, the task is to go from one arm position (the
initial position) to some other specified arm position (the goal position)
without colliding with any objects in the workspace. In general, this problem
is representative of a whole class of related planning and navigation problems.<u1:p></u1:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Demonstrate,
benchmark, and compare Breadth-First, Depth-First, Uniform Cost, Iterative
Deepening, Greedy Best First, A*, and Iterative Deepening A* search on this route-finding
problem.<u1:p></u1:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>This
project is also used at the undergraduate level (CS-171); <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/JavaPolygon">a Java shell is available</a>; <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/JavaPolygon/Java%20Polygon%20Description.pdf">a
Java description is available</a>; <a href="../projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon">a
C++ shell is available</a>; <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon/Cpp%20Polygon%20Description.pdf">a C++
description is available</a>; <a href="../projects/maze-solver/game.exe">an
example game is available</a>.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>At
the graduate level: (1) more technical ingenuity is required, i.e., you are
required to find a heuristic for A* that dominates Straight-Line-Distance; and
(2) more insightful analysis is required, i.e., you are required to write a
5-page conference style paper as if you had invented all these search
techniques (except Depth- and Breadth-First), wherein you compare and discuss
them professionally.<u1:p></u1:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>As
announced in lecture, to accommodate introductory students who are still honing
their programming skills, examples of DFS and BFS are made available: <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon/DFSPolygonComplete">C++ DFS</a>; <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon/BFSPolygonComplete">C++ BFS</a>; <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/JavaPolygon/JavaDFSBFSSolution">Java DFS&BFS</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>They are also available through the C++
and Java folders indicated above.</span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>(2)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="../projects/connect-k/Connect.exe">Connect-K Game</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This project corresponds to Game Search
(Chapter 5 in your book). Your job is to write an AI agent that can beat you at
Connect-K, i.e., to write the adversarial search (“game search”)
controller for a video game world.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>This project is also used at the
undergraduate level (CS-171); <a href="../projects/connect-k/connectgame/symvc">a
Java shell is available</a>; <a href="../projects/connect-k/connectgame/vcpp">a
C++ shell is available</a>; <a
href="../projects/connect-k/ConnectFINAL_cpp/SampleExecutable/SampleConnect.exe">an
example “dumb” game is available</a>; <a
href="../projects/connect-k/ConnectFINAL_cpp/FullExecutable/Connect.exe">an
example “smart” game is available</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span class=GramE>A student has kindly
contributed the Java packages for the term project game and put them together
into a jar file (<a href="../projects/connect-k/sfc.jar">available here</a>).</span></span>
<span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A student has kindly written a
java application for use with the term project game, from scratch, using Swing
(<a href="../projects/connect-k/src.zip">available here</a>).</span><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>At the graduate level more
insightful analysis is required than at the undergraduate level, i.e., you are
required to write a 5-page conference style paper wherein you discuss your
project professionally. Also, at the graduate level more technical expertise is
expected; e.g., you will find that the example “smart” game takes
far too much time when run with a large branching factor (e.g., gravity
“off” with all other defaults), and you will be expected to fix that
problem.</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>There is also a
“tournament” shell that was begun by the undergraduate working on
the code, but I am not sure that it ever worked correctly (<a
href="../projects/connect-k/TournamentFINAL">available here</a>).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will offer extra credit to any
students who are sufficiently interested in playing a “tournament”
to get that code working.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.25in'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>(3<span
class=GramE>)</span><a href="../projects/sudoku-solver/aiproject2011.pdf">Sudoku
Solver</a>.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This project corresponds
to Constraint Satisfaction Problems (Chapter 6 in your book).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your job is to write an AI agent that
can solve the Sudoku problems that appear in the newspaper.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>You will find
that the first method (backtracking search with forward checking) is
sufficiently powerful to solve most Sudoku problems, and so, disappointingly,
there is little advantage beyond intellectual satisfaction in implementing more
powerful methods.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Still, there is
some comfort in knowing that even simple methods have great power, and that
even greater power is available if needed.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Although the
instructions specify that you must use Java, this is for the undergraduate
grading rubric.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Since the project
is ungraded, you may use any language you wish.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'> </span></span></span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;
text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Previous
CS-271 Quizzes, Mid-term exams, and Final exams are available here as study

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>As an
incentive to study this material, at least one question from a previous Quiz or
Exam will appear on every new Quiz or Exam. In particular, questions that many
students missed are likely to appear again. If you missed a question, please
study it carefully and learn from your mistake --- so that if it appears again,
you will understand it perfectly.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext;font-weight:normal;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable and will not be
tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the responsibility of
each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic honesty policies.
Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://www.senate.uci.edu/senateweb/default2.asp?active_page_id=754">UCI
Senate Academic Honesty Policies</a> and the <a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/index.php#cheating">ICS School
policy on cheating</a>.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p>The policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student
who engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion
in dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students. </p>
